intro: Lloydia libanotica, commonly known as the Lebanon lloydia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. It blooms in spring, producing white or pale pink flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
